info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 9 at 5:46PM CDT until July 9 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Gillespie.
* WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 546 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fredericksburg, Cherry Spring, Crabapple, Doss, Enchanted Rock State Natural Area, Eckert, Willow City and Harper. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING
